  • Deoxys-A can be extremely reliant on entry hazards and general chip damage to secure many notable OHKOs, so hazard setters like Primal Groudon, Necrozma-DM, Arceus-Ground, and Eternatus are good partners.
  • Deoxys-A is easily revenge killed by Marshadow and checked by Dark-types like Yveltal—particularly Sucker Punch variants—and Arceus-Dark, so Pokemon that handle them well like Arceus-Fairy and support variants of Yveltal are useful teammates. The former can also be handy against Arceus-Dark and Yveltal, which can otherwise be a great hinderance to Deoxys-A, while the latter is a rare source of pivoting in U-turn, which can be used to give Deoxys-A additional wallbreaking opportunities.

Lead.description:
• Having wide coverage to bluff offensive pressure alongside a Speed tier above the vast majority of the metagame, Deoxys-A can act as a formidable entry hazard setter that can also compress roles as a wallbreaker, filling a niche of hyper offense teams.
  • Psycho Boost acts as a strong STAB move that limits Glimmora to only set a single entry hazard at most, and has high odds to OHKO Eruption Primal Groudon. Counter is an alternative to OHKO foes such as Necrozma-DM and Ho-Oh after luring an attack while having its Focus Sash intact, giving a means for Deoxys-A to play around such checks.
  • Shadow Ball provides coverage to super effectively target anti-leads such as Necrozma-DM and Deoxys-S, avoiding passivity and giving the rest of its team an easier chance to break past them by wearing them down.
  • Icy Wind allows Deoxys-A to anti-lead Deoxys-S, enabling Deoxys-A to outspeed and KO it with Shadow Ball afterwards. This move can also be used to wear down setup sweepers like Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM and Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground, rendering them easier to revenge kill by mitigating their Speed stat boosts.
  • Tera Steel grants an immunity to Glimmora's Mortal Spin, giving the situational use to preserve entry hazards on the other side of the field.
  • By keeping Deoxys-A for the middle stages of the game instead of leading with it, it can bluff as another set variant of itself, allowing it to set entry hazards mid-game on expected switches. This strategy is usually ideal if the foe is likely to lead with a Pokemon that Deoxys-A can't play around depending on its set, such as Yveltal for sets without Icy Wind, and Grimmsnarl for any variant outside of Taunt, but entry hazards should be kept out of its side of the field to ensure Deoxys-A can use its Focus Sash.
  • As the offensive pressure of Deoxys-A relies on forcing the opponent to scout its moveset, it's best to not unecessarily reveal parts of its moveset unless the situation calls for it.
  • Deoxys-A can struggle to get past Defoggers such as Ho-Oh, Yveltal, and Arceus-Dark, and Steel-types including Necrozma-DM and Ferrothorn, therefore allies such as Tera Electric Zacian-C, Marshadow, and Double Dance Primal Groudon make great allies to wallbreak past them.
  • Hyper offense Pokemon such as Necrozma-DM, Arceus-Ground, and Eternatus appreciate the entry hazards laid by Deoxys-A to more often threaten the opposing team with a sweep by wearing down their checks and punishing switching.

Meteor Beam.description:
• Meteor Beam Deoxys-A is an excellent wallbreaker and sweeper thanks to its massive Special Attack stat, great Speed tier, and extensive offensive coverage for Psychic Terrain teams.
  • Expanding Force is an extremely powerful option under Psychic Terrain, having a chance to 3HKO Chansey at +1. Psycho Boost is Deoxys-A’s most powerful Psychic-type STAB move, providing Deoxys-A with a strong wallbreaking attack even when Psychic Terrain isn’t active. Psycho Boost OHKOes Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy, defensive Arceus-Water, and wallbreaker Primal Kyogre at +1 after two layers of Spikes.
  • Focus Blast provides essential coverage against Arceus-Dark and Zacian-C. Shadow Ball and Dark Pulse are both options for coverage against Necrozma-DM. If Deoxys-A is Tera Ghost, Shadow Ball should be chosen for the increased boost, as it guarantees a 2HKO on Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM. Otherwise, Dark Pulse should be chosen due to its flinch chance.
  • Tera Psychic allows Deoxys-A to OHKO Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy, defensive Arceus-Water, and Wallbreaker Primal Kyogre with Psycho Boost at +1, and OHKO Ho-Oh at +1 under Psychic Terrain. For Expanding Force, Tera Psychic gives Deoxys-A a chance to 2HKO Chansey under Psychic Terrain at +1. However, Tera Psychic leaves Deoxys-A susceptible to priority if Psychic Terrain isn’t active.
  • Tera Ghost allows Deoxys-A to avoid being revenge killed by Extreme Speed from Arceus and Rayquaza while also boosting Shadow Ball. Tera Normal prevents Marshadow and Giratina-O from revenge killing it with Shadow Sneak.
  • As Deoxys-A is a potent wallbreaker even without a boost, it does not need to use Meteor Beam until the prime opportunity for a sweep, such as when its checks in Yveltal or Ho-Oh have been baited in.
  • As Deoxys-A is extremely frail, it should only switch in on a free turn such as after a teammate faints. On Psychic Terrain teams, it is best to sacrifice Tapu Lele as a means to give Deoxys-A a free switch in and maximize the time it can take advantage of Psychic Terrain.
  • Tapu Lele is an essential teammate for Psychic Terrain, as it is the most viable setter. Meteor Beam Lunala pairs well with Deoxys-A on Psychic Terrain teams, as the two of them can overwhelm Yveltal and Ho-Oh defensive cores. With Lunala eliminating one of these threats, Deoxys-A is free to use its Meteor Beam to eliminate the other part of the core without worrying about being stopped in the middle of a sweep afterwards.
  • Glimmora is an excellent teammate for Deoxys-A, as the entry hazard it provides eases sweeping. In addition, Toxic Spikes is able to chip Arceus-Dark, which puts it in Focus Blast range. In return, Deoxys-A is able to threaten common Defoggers such as Ho-Oh and Yveltal. Smeargle and Shuckle can be used instead to provide Sticky Web, as this greatly aids other Psychic Terrain teammates such as Lunala and Basculegion.

Entry Hazard Setter.description:
• Deoxys-S clocks in at a blistering base 180 Speed, making it the naturally fastest viable Pokemon in the tier. With a diverse support movepool and passable bulk, Deoxys-S establishes itself as the premier entry hazard setter for hyper offense teams.
  • Magic Coat allows Deoxys-S to bounce opposing Taunt from Grimmsnarl and entry hazards from other suicide leads like Shuckle and Smeargle.
  • Psycho Boost is an alternative to Spikes, giving Deoxys-S a powerful STAB move that can heavily damage anything that tries to take advantage of its relatively passive nature, like Marshadow and Flutter Mane.
  • Rocky Helmet provides valuable chip damage against foes like Zacian-C, which puts it within OHKO range of Necrozma-DM's Earthquake, but Focus Sash can be an alternative for the frailer spread as to ensure Deoxys-S can withstand virtually any attack once to lay more entry hazards.
  • 16 Speed EVs and a Timid nature allow Deoxys-S to outspeed Deoxys-A and Zacian-C, while the HP and Defense EVs avoid a 2HKO from Arceus's Extreme Speed and Rayquaza's combination of Dragon Ascent + Extreme Speed. A frailer spread can be used instead to maximize Speed, ensuring that Deoxys-S outspeeds Choice Scarf users like Yveltal and Galarian Darmanitan.
  • Tera Steel allows Deoxys-S to block Mortal Spin from Glimmora, keeping up hazards, as well as giving a crucial resistance to Extreme Speed from Arceus. However, Deoxys-S generally wants to avoid Terastallizing, saving the slot for one of its teammates instead.
  • Deoxys-S is best used as a lead, since it provides little defensive or offensive options to its team, so it is usually worth sacrificing early-game for an extra layer of entry hazards or a fast Taunt to deny opposing sweepers from setting up, such as Mega Salamence and Zygarde-C.
  • The hazards Deoxys-S lays serve as an excellent enabler for powerful sweepers like Arceus-Ground, Zacian-C, Mega Mewtwo Y, Primal Kyogre, and Ultra Necrozma, and teammates like Primal Groudon and Meteor Beam Eternatus can threaten hazard removers, especially Ho-Oh.

Dual Screens.description:
• Being the naturally fastest viable Pokemon in the tier, Deoxys-S establishes itself as an excellent dual screens setter for hyper offense teams.
  • Magic Coat allows Deoxys-S to beat other leads, bouncing back opposing Taunt from Grimmsnarl, entry hazards from setters like Shuckle and Glimmora, and Spore from Smeargle.
  • Taunt is invaluable to Deoxys-S, not only giving it another way to prevent opposing leads from setting entry hazards, but also denying Defog from Pokemon like Arceus-Water and Giratina-O, which would otherwise remove its dual screens.
  • Deoxys-S can use Tera Ghost to avoid trapping from Zygarde-C and Gothitelle as well as blank Extreme Speed from Arceus. However, it is generally best to avoid Terastallizing Deoxys-S, saving the slot for one of its teammates instead.
  • Deoxys-S is best used as a lead, since it provides little defensive or offensive options to its team, so it is usually worth sacrificing early-game for a second layer of dual screens or a fast Taunt to stop opposing sweepers such as Arceus-Ground and Mega Mewtwo Y from setting up. Against physical threats like Rayquaza and Marshadow, Deoxys-S should set Reflect first, while against special threats like Flutter Mane and Palkia-O, it should set Light Screen to ensure it can survive a hit and set Reflect.
  • Dual screens Deoxys-S sets are perfect enablers for bulkier sweepers like Zygarde-C, Necrozma-DM, Zacian-C, Arceus-Fairy, Arceus-Water, and Primal Groudon. Deoxys-S also appreciates teammates like Primal Kyogre and Meteor Beam Eternatus, which threaten Defoggers, especially Ho-Oh.

Choice Specs.description:
• Dialga's unique typing and good offensive stats give it a niche as a strong wallbreaker that is also able to soft check Pokemon such as Primal Kyogre, Eternatus, Palkia-O, and utility Arceus formes. However, its middling Speed and weakness to common Ground-types such as Primal Groudon and Arceus-Ground mean Dialga can struggle to get into a game safely, especially without reliable recovery; it also faces heavy competition from Eternatus and Palkia-O as a powerful attacker in bulky offense and balance teams alike.
  • Trick allows Dialga to cripple switch-ins such as Ho-Oh, Zygarde, Ferrothorn, and Chansey, allowing its teammates to break through the opposing team much more easily.
  • Draco Meteor is Dialga's strongest attack, being able to 2HKO defensive Primal Groudon, offensive Primal Kyogre, and utility Arceus formes and OHKO offensive Primal Groudon, Zygarde-C, and specially offensive Yveltal.
  • Fire Blast allows Dialga to OHKO Zacian-C on the switch and 2HKO defensive Necrozma-DM, preventing the latter from being a reliable switch-in.
  • Thunder hits defensive Primal Kyogre, Arceus-Water, and Ho-Oh for great damage while preventing Arceus-Fairy or Zacian-C from switching in reliably, unlike Draco Meteor. Flash Cannon prevents Fairy-types from walling Dialga, being able to OHKO Arceus-Fairy after Stealth Rock, thus preventing Dialga from being setup fodder for it while also being able to break through Tera Fairy Eternatus and Zygarde variants; however, it is generally less desirable, since it lets Ho-Oh come into Dialga more often.
  • The given EV spread avoids the 2HKO from Tera Normal Extreme Speed from Arceus and Arceus-Fairy's uninvested Judgment while always outspeeding Adamant Necrozma-DM.
  • Tera Dragon not only removes Dialga's weakness to Ground- and Fighting-type attacks but also pushes Draco Meteor's damage to new heights, being able to OHKO Extreme Killer Arceus, utility Arceus formes, and defensive Yveltal while also being able to 2HKO defensive Primal Kyogre and offensive Necrozma-DM.
  • Dialga is quite prediction reliant, so spamming Draco Meteor is heavily discouraged, as it can turn Dialga into setup fodder, especially if there are Steel- or Fairy-types on the opposing team. Double switching against predicted switch-ins such as Zacian-C and Necrozma-DM into checks such as Primal Groudon and Ho-Oh can maintain the team's momentum while keeping the pressure Dialga brings on defensive backbones. Using Trick can also be somewhat difficult, since Arceus formes barring Extreme Killer, Zacian-C, and Z-Move Necrozma-DM can stop it. Therefore, Trick should mostly be used against more passive and slower teams, such as stall, against Pokemon Dialga would typically come in on like defensive Yveltal, defensive Eternatus, Ferrothorn, and Alomomola.
  • Dialga typically fits on balance and bulky offense structures that appreciate its offensive and defensive capabilities while not worrying about its mediocre Speed tier. It appreciates teammates that can setup entry hazards so it can reach important damage thresholds such as OHKOing Arceus-Fairy after Stealth Rock with Flash Cannon. Teammates such as Primal Groudon, Necrozma-DM, and utility Arceus formes are good for this; the former also appreciates Dialga briefly checking Primal Kyogre for it. Ground-type switch-ins such as Giratina-O, Ho-Oh, and Yveltal are great partners to handle Primal Groudon and Arceus-Ground, with all three also being good switch-ins to Marshadow, which can threaten Dialga with Low Kick. Zygarde is also a good switch-in to Marshadow and Primal Groudon while offering Glare support to help Dialga handle faster threats such as Zacian-C or Palkia-O.
  • Strong special attackers such as Primal Kyogre, Eternatus, and Calm Mind Arceus formes like Dialga crippling special walls like Ho-Oh or Chansey so they can clear through teams much more easily. Strong physical attackers such as Primal Groudon, Marshadow, and Zacian-C also appreciate Dialga smashing through physical walls like Zygarde, Primal Groudon, Arceus-Dark, and Dondozo, while they can help overwhelm the defensive backbone of many balance teams.

Wallbreaker.description:
• Palkia-O uses its powerful Water / Dragon STAB combination, further bolstered by Lustrous Globe, its high Special Attack, supplemented with Fire-type coverage, to become a nuclear wallbreaker that excels at eviscerating the defensive backbone of many balance teams. Palkia-O is capable of 2HKOing defensive stalwarts such as Ho-Oh, Primal Groudon, Eternatus, and support Arceus formes.
  • Fire Blast roasts Ferrothorn while also hitting Tera Grass Ho-Oh for slightly more damage than Spacial Rend.
  • Palkia-O's last moveslot is rather flexible. Substitute takes advantage of the many switches Palkia-O forces and protects it from status moves. Alternatively, Draco Meteor enables Palkia-O to nab some OHKOs on Pokemon that Spacial Rend cannot, such as defensive Eternatus, Zygarde-C, and Eruption Primal Groudon after Stealth Rock.
  • A Modest nature is preferred to enhance Palkia-O's wallbreaking capabilities. A Timid nature is usable if outspeeding Adamant Ultra Necrozma and Speed tying Calm Mind Arceus formes is desired. However, running a Timid nature comes at the cost of never OHKOing defensive Eternatus, turning defensive Primal Groudon into a roll to 2HKO, and rarely 2HKOing Primal Kyogre with Spacial Rend.
  • Tera Water is used over Tera Dragon, since Primal Groudon is 2HKOed by Spacial Rend regardless. Tera Water Hydro Pump is capable of OHKOing Ho-Oh, Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM after a single layer of Spikes, and support Arceus formes after Stealth Rock and a layer of Spikes.
  • Palkia-O is best used as an early- or mid-game wallbreaker on balance and bulky offense teams to tear through the defensive backbone of balance teams. It struggles against hyper offense teams, as it can be outsped or set up on, limiting the damage it can do. Against these teams, Palkia-O is often limited to trading. Additionally, Palkia-O completely thuds into stall, as it is fully walled by Chansey.
  • Choice Band Marshadow is an excellent teammate, as it is able to revenge kill many Pokemon that use Palkia-O as setup fodder on hyper offense teams, such as Ultra Necrozma, Deoxys-A, Arceus, and Zacian-C.
  • Ho-Oh makes an excellent partner, as it is able to switch in on Pokemon that scare Palkia-O out, such as Arceus-Fairy, Deoxys-A, and Zacian-C. Furthermore, Palkia-O greatly appreciates Defog support from Ho-Oh due to its vulnerability to every entry hazard and lack of recovery.
  • Palkia-O also appreciates teammates that match up well into stall, such as specially offensive Yveltal and Overheat Primal Groudon.

Physical Wall.description:
• Giratina is an excellent wall on stall teams thanks to its massive mixed bulk and useful typing. This makes it an excellent check to threats such as Primal Groudon and Arceus. Giratina has useful utility with Defog and pairs well with Ho-Oh as a double Defog core. The two are able to consistently keep entry hazards off throughout the game, as Giratina can use Defog against Primal Groudon, while Ho-Oh can use Defog against defensive Eternatus. In addition, Giratina has a very valuable PP stalling ability in Pressure, allowing it to stall the PP of Choice Band Rayquaza, an extremely dangerous wallbreaker against stall.
  • Dragon Tail allows Giratina to phaze setup sweepers such as Arceus, Zekrom, and Necrozma-DM while dealing respectable damage to frailer Dragon-type setup sweepers such as Rayquaza and Mega Salamence. Dragon Tail is also a great way to spread chip damage against the opposing team, especially with entry hazard support from Arceus-Dark, Eternatus, or Mega Tyranitar.
  • Toxic allows Giratina to slowly damage targets such as Primal Groudon and Ho-Oh while preventing wallbreakers such as specially offensive Yveltal, Lunala, and Rayquaza from switching in freely.
  • Defog allows Giratina to remove hazards from the field, aiding hazard-vulnerable allies such as Dondozo, Chansey, and Arceus-Dark. This provides stall teams with much more longevity, allowing them to outlast hazard setters such as defensive Primal Groudon and Ferrothorn. However, Giratina is unable to use Defog against Taunt Arceus-Fairy.
  • Tera Fairy allows Giratina to check Palkia-O and non-Sludge Bomb Eternatus more efficiently while enabling it to emergency check the rare Zekrom and force it out with Dragon Tail.
  • Tera Poison gives Giratina a resistance to Fairy as well as a useful immunity to Toxic and the ability to absorb Toxic Spikes, allowing it to effectively check Arceus-Fairy and defensive Eternatus.
  • Giratina is useful early-game to scout Primal Groudon sets so that Dondozo isn’t sniped by Eruption or Overheat. Thanks to its ability to check every Primal Groudon set, Dondozo is free to preserve its HP to check threats such as Mega Salamence and Arceus.
  • Throughout the game, Giratina is an excellent setup disruptor with Dragon Tail. Against balance teams, Giratina should attempt to stay on the field and spread chip damage against foes by using Toxic and then Dragon Tail on Pokemon such as Primal Groudon and Ho-Oh. Against Choice Band Rayquaza, Giratina can be sacrificed in order to waste four of Dragon Ascent’s PP if necessary, although it should not directly switch into Rayquaza.
  • Giratina is easily set up on by Zacian-C, as Giratina cannot phaze it with Dragon Tail or use Toxic on it. Dondozo is an excellent teammate, as it is one of the few Pokemon that counters Zacian-C thanks to Unaware. Giratina cannot deal with Ultra Necrozma after setup, so Arceus-Dark is an excellent teammate, as it is immune to Photon Geyser and heavily punishes setup with Foul Play.
  • Taunt or Refresh Arceus-Fairy easily sets up on Giratina, while Eternatus can overwhelm Giratina with Dynamax Cannon, so Chansey makes a great teammate, as it is an excellent special wall to deal with these threats.

Physical Utility.description:
• Giratina-O's great offensive typing, coupled with Levitate, allows it to reliably Defog against staple entry hazard setters such as Primal Groudon and Necrozma-DM; it is also able to check strong attackers including Extreme Killer Arceus, Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground, and Ho-Oh. However, although its typing is excellent offensively, it leaves a bit to be desired defensively, since Giratina-O is weak to a lot of common types in the tier, which doesn't go well with Giratina-O's lack of reliable recovery. Regardless, these useful traits make Giratina-O a staple on bulky offense and balance teams alike.
  • Dragon Tail prevents setup from opposing threats such as Arceus and Primal Groudon, which Giratina-O would otherwise struggle to slow down due to their natural bulk.
  • Toxic punishes switch-ins such as Arceus-Fairy and Yveltal, as well as threatening defensive Primal Groudon that would handle Poltergeist more directly, making it the most consistent of the bunch because it will always be useful in a game. Will-O-Wisp cripples physical attackers such as Zacian-C and Necrozma-DM, preventing Giratina-O from being too passive against the former, while Thunder Wave handles threats such as Eternatus and Calm Mind Arceus formes lacking Refresh.
  • Shadow Sneak is a niche alternative that allows Giratina-O to revenge kill frailer foes such as Deoxys-A and Mega Mewtwo Y, but this comes at the cost of not being able to punish bulkier switch-ins like defensive Yveltal or Arceus-Fairy.
  • The following EV spread allows Giratina-O to avoid the 2HKO from Mega Salamence's Double Edge while 2HKOing defensive Necrozma-DM and offensive Eternatus with Poltergeist. An alternative EV spread can be used for Shadow Sneak variants, allowing Giratina-O to avoid the 2HKO from Mega Mewtwo Y's Psystrike while ensuring a 3HKO on defensive Primal Groudon and an OHKO against offensive Necrozma-DM, both after Stealth Rock.
  • Giratina-O's typing is really important to the balance and bulky offense playstyles it fits on, so Terastallizing Giratina-O is only useful in emergencies. Tera Poison allows Giratina-O to gain a poison immunity while also providing a resistance to Fairy, which is useful versus Arceus-Fairy and Play Rough Zacian-C. Unlike Tera Steel, it avoids being weak to Fire and Fighting, preventing Giratina-O from being weak to Low Kick Marshadow and Overheat Primal Groudon.
  • Tera Steel, however, grants a Rock resistance, which is useful versus Stone Edge Primal Groudon and Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground, while also letting Giratina-O handle Mega Salamence, Rayquaza, and Ultra Necrozma more comfortably. It also lets Giratina-O tank Dragon-type attacks from offensive Eternatus and phaze it away with Dragon Tail, removing its boosts and hitting it hard. However, it makes Giratina-O a riskier switch-in to Overheat and Heat Crash variants of Primal Groudon, as well as making it weak to Fighting-type moves from Marshadow and Zacian-C.
  • Because Giratina-O cannot reliably heal, health management is very important, which includes avoiding status, such as poison from Ho-Oh. This is to ensure Giratina-O has enough HP to reliably check what it needs to, since it would otherwise be overwhelmed by boosted attacks from Primal Groudon and Extreme Killer Arceus.
  • Against bulkier teams, it would be more beneficial for Giratina-O to use status moves such as Toxic or Thunder Wave to benefit its teammates more rather than attempting to deal damage with Poltergeist. This is because the status moves have better long-term impact against switch-ins like Arceus-Dark and Arceus-Fairy, while they would otherwise be able to just heal up any damage taken from Poltergeist. This is also why Toxic is generally the best option out of the three status moves, since it allows Giratina-O to make more progress versus Zygarde and Primal Groudon; the latter is a Pokemon Giratina-O should ordinarily check but can't due to its lackluster damage output against it.
  • Due to Giratina-O's lack of healing, Alomomola is an excellent teammate for it, as it is able to pivot into Giratina-O against Pokemon that would otherwise take advantage of it, such as Necrozma-DM and Primal Groudon, while also healing it up via Wish; Alomomola is also a great status absorber for Giratina-O, letting the latter avoid the residual damage it hates taking, such as Ho-Oh's Sacred Fire burns, while letting Giratina-O run status moves aside from Toxic such as Thunder Wave to better handle Zacian-C and Eternatus. Alomomola is also good at enabling Pokemon that Giratina-O appreciates, such as Chien-Pao, which threatens out Zygarde and Yveltal, and Ditto, which helps pressure out offensive sweepers such as Zacian-C and Meteor Beam Eternatus.
  • Arceus-Fairy makes up for Giratina-O's weaknesses to Dark-types including Yveltal and Arceus-Dark while handling Marshadow and switching into opposing Dragon-type attacks from Palkia-O to preserve Giratina-O's health. Stealth Rock variants are especially appreciated, since Giratina-O can abuse hazards well with Dragon Tail. This also applies to other hazard setters including Primal Groudon and Necrozma-DM, both of which handle the Fairy-types that Giratina-O cannot deal with; the former also helps versus Primal Kyogre, which would chip Giratina-O down with Ice Beam.
  • Offensive teammates such as Zacian-C and Necrozma-DM appreciate Giratina-O breaking down defensive walls such as Primal Groudon and defensive Necrozma-DM, while they in return handle the Dragon-, Fairy- and Ice-types that Giratina-O cannot handle, including Eternatus, Arceus-Fairy and Calyrex-I; the former also handles Dark-types such as Yveltal and Arceus-Dark.

Special Utility.description:
• Thanks to its excellent typing paired with Levitate, Giratina-O serves as an excellent Defogger on bulky offense structures and checks common threats such as Primal Groudon, Coil Zygarde, and Arceus. With a Specially Offensive set, Giratina-O is able to more immediately threaten Primal Groudon and Zygarde while dealing much more damage to Yveltal and Eternatus. Giratina-O can also fit on balance structures with Alomomola's Wish support due to the amazing role compression it offers. Giratina-O needs Alomomola support in order to offset its longevity issues and survive for the longer games balance teams tend to have.
  • Giratina-O's choice of status determines what it is able to cripple long-term and what it cannot deal with. The status selection highly depends on the team composition Giratina-O finds itself on. Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave are strong into offense, while Toxic can help break down Primal Groudon and Ho-Oh balances. Will-O-Wisp is able to cripple threats such as Zacian-C, Arceus, and Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground. Thunder Wave is able to deal with Pokemon such as Zacian-C and Eternatus by allowing teammates such as Marshadow and Eternatus to outspeed these threats. Toxic chips down Ho-Oh, Zygarde, Primal Groudon, and support Arceus formes, allowing allies such as Zacian-C and Marshadow more easily sweep late-game. However, Toxic sets greatly struggle with Zacian-C, Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM, and Calm Mind Arceus formes running Tera Poison.
  • The given EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Primal Groudon's Eruption and Mega Mewtwo Y's Psystrike after Stealth Rock. In addition, it guarantees a 2HKO on Eruption Primal Groudon with Draco Meteor. Giratina-O can invest 12 Speed EVs to outspeed paralyzed Zacian-C, though this means defensive EVs must be sacrificed. The second EV spread allows Giratina-O to survive a +3 Behemoth Blade from Zacian-C, a +2 Stone Edge from Primal Groudon, a Life Orb Yveltal's Dark Pulse, and a Tera Ghost Deoxys-A's Shadow Ball from full HP. It also is highly likely that Arceus-Dark's Foul Play is a 3HKO. In addition, Hex 3HKOes Coil Zygarde after status and Draco Meteor 2HKOed utility Swords Dance Primal Groudon, and Giratina-O can outspeed uninvested Zygarde and paralyzed Zacian-C.
  • A well-timed Terastallization is extremely powerful with Giratina-O. Tera Poison allows Giratina-O to tank any +3 attack from Zacian-C or Dynamax Cannon from Eternatus. This allows Giratina-O to deliver a devastating Will-O-Wisp or Thunder Wave to cripple these threats for the rest of the game. In addition, it is useful to check Marshadow, offensive Eternatus, and non-Taunt Arceus-Fairy. The poison immunity also gives Giratina-O much more longevity against bulky balance and stall structures.
  • Tera Steel provides similar utility as Tera Poison such as tanking a hit from Zacian-C lacking Close Combat or defensive Eternatus while delivering a crippling status and gaining a poison immunity. Tera Steel is able to wall Arceus-Ground, Ultra Necrozma, defensive Eternatus, and Mega Salamence more efficiently. However, Giratina-O loses the ability to check Primal Groudon sets with Overheat or Eruption and is still vulnerable to offensive Eternatus with Fire Blast. In addition, Giratina-O becomes vulnerable to Close Combat from Zacian-C and Low Kick from Marshadow.
  • Giratina-O serves as a Defogger and a reliable switch-in to all Primal Groudon sets on bulky offense, though it does not appreciate getting hit by Toxic. It is also valued for its status, allowing it to cripple threats such as Zacian-C and offensive Eternatus. Due to Giratina-O's limited longevity, it should be used sparingly early-game so that it has enough HP to fulfill these roles. As Zacian-C and Meteor Beam Eternatus can quickly run through defensive cores, Giratina-O should preserve its HP to cripple these threats with status in most cases. Teammates that have better longevity such as Arceus-Fairy and Calm Mind Arceus-Dark should be used to scout sets from threats such as Yveltal early-game. In addition, Coil Zygarde and Primal Groudon are appreciated to check physical wallbreakers such as Choice Band Marshadow early-game. Giratina-O also appreciates offensive teammates such as Marshadow and Dragon Dance Zygarde.
  • Giratina-O does not have the longevity to fit well on most balance structures, but Alomomola patches Giratina-O's longevity issues with Wish. This allows Giratina-O to be more aggressive in checking threats such as Primal Groudon and Zygarde early-game. In addition, Alomomola is able to easily use Toxic against Primal Groudon and Ho-Oh, allowing Giratina-O to drop Toxic to better check Zacian-C and Eternatus. However, this core struggles against Calm Mind Arceus formes, so Pokemon such as Taunt Arceus-Fairy, Fezandipiti, and defensive Eternatus are essential.
  • Giratina-O struggles massively against Taunt + Calm Mind Arceus-Dark and Arceus-Fairy. Therefore, Pokemon such as Zacian-C make excellent teammates. Giratina-O also struggles against specially offensive Yveltal, so Calm Mind Arceus-Dark, Fezandipiti, defensive and Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy, and Heavy-Duty Boots defensive Eternatus are great allies. Giratina-O is able to cripple threats such as Zacian-C, Eternatus, and Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground lacking Taunt with status moves. Giratina-O can become setup fodder to defensive Primal Kyogre, so Pokemon such as Ferrothorn and defensive Primal Groudon are useful teammates. In exchange, Giratina-O checks opposing Primal Groudon that threaten them. Giratina-O is also bad into stall and walled by Chansey. Therefore, Defensive Kyogre is a great teammate.

Trick Room Setter.description:
• Cresselia is an excellent Trick Room setter due to its high bulk, useful utility, and access to Levitate. Due to these qualities, it can set Trick Room on powerful wallbreakers such as Primal Groudon, Primal Kyogre, and even Yveltal.
  • Lunar Dance allows Cresselia to keep momentum for the team after setting Trick Room. Its ability to restore PP allows teammates such as Melmetal and Calyrex-I to wallbreak mid-game without worrying about the PP of their STAB moves late-game.
  • Magic Coat prevents foes such as Ferrothorn and Primal Groudon from setting up entry hazards. If Cresselia's Mental Herb is used up, Magic Coat can be useful to deny threats such as Arceus-Ground and Yveltal from using Taunt, although it is a risky choice against the latter.
  • Toxic is useful to deal chip damage to walls such as Primal Groudon, Arceus-Dark, and Giratina-O. This allows Melmetal and Calyrex-I to wallbreak past these checks more easily. Alternatively, Future Sight can produce similar pressure and makes switching in harder for the opponent, being able to OHKO defensive Ho-Oh after Choice Band Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance and defensive Primal Groudon after Tera Ice Choice Band Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance.
  • The given EV spread avoids an OHKO from a fully powered Primal Kyogre's Water Spout, Double Dance Primal Groudon's Heat Crash after Stealth Rock, +3 Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade, +2 Tera Ghost Arceus's Shadow Claw, and Life Orb Yveltal's Dark Pulse or Knock Off.
  • Tera Water allows Cresselia to set Trick Room on +2 Heat Crash Primal Groudon, although this is a dead Tera slot otherwise and is wasted if the opposing Primal Groudon isn't carrying Heat Crash. Therefore, Cresselia should not use Tera often, as teammates such as Melmetal and Calyrex-I need it to wallbreak.
  • Cresselia is best used as a mid- to late-game setter. Due to its great bulk, Cresselia can usually switch in for a teammate once Trick Room ends, tank a couple of hits from threats like Arceus and Primal Groudon, and set Trick Room. Cresselia switches in for Melmetal especially well, as it is immune to Ground-type attacks directed at Melmetal thanks to Levitate.
  • When Cresselia is up against Pokemon that cannot 2HKO it such as defensive Primal Groudon and Arceus Ground, it may be best to first use Toxic or Future Sight in order to weaken them for teammates. This should not be done against Zygarde, however, as it can wall Calyrex-I and Melmetal with Tera Water after a Coil. When entry hazard setters such as Ferrothorn are on the field, it may be best for Cresselia to use Magic Coat first to punish attempts to set Spikes.
  • Pokemon that appreciate Trick Room support on top of PP restoration such as Melmetal and Calyrex-I make excellent teammates. Calyrex-I specifically greatly appreciates Cresselia keeping off Stealth Rock with Magic Coat.
  • Cresselia needs support in setting Trick Room, as usually it is only able to set one round of it. As a result, additional setters such as Hatterene and Arceus are great teammates.

Extreme Killer.description:
• With its sheer power, decent bulk, and solid movepool options, Arceus defines itself as one of the tier's most devastating setup sweepers, wallbreakers, and revenge killers. Terastalization, whether it be Normal or Ghost, makes Arceus even more difficult to answer for balance and bulky offense teams due to either its extreme power or improved trading capabilities with would-be revenge killers. Due to it not requiring specific support to function effectively, it is a staple for various hyper offense structures that appreciate a bulky setup sweeper that works well against opposing hyper offense teams.

  • Extreme Speed lets Arceus clean through weakened teams, since not many viable Pokemon resist or are immune to it. Combined with Swords Dance, Arceus can clean up the majority of the offensive metagame, including threats such as Eternatus, Ultra Necrozma, and Sucker Punch Yveltal. Shadow Claw synergizes perfectly with Extreme Speed, hitting Ghost-types such as Giratina-O, Marshadow, and Lunala, which are immune to Extreme Speed, and preventing them being reliable checks to Arceus.

  • Double-Edge makes the most out of the limited number of foes that can switch into Normal-type moves to enhance Arceus's wallbreaking capabilities. It is able to OHKO defensive Ho-Oh and defensive Primal Kyogre after a boost. With Tera Normal, it can also OHKO Coil Zygarde at +2, preventing it from being a consistent check.

  • Taunt denies status conditions from Giratina-O, Alomomola, and support Arceus formes as well as opposing setup from slower foes such as Coil Zygarde and IronPress Garganacl. It has good merit for hyper offense teams too, denying Defog from Ho-Oh and the aforementioned Giratina-O.

  • Recover is a niche option that lets Arceus shrug off attacks, such as Giratina-O's Draco Meteor, Choice Specs Lunala's Moonblast, and support Arceus's Judgment; it notably let Arceus beat Thunder Wave variants of Giratina-O due to its Special Attack drops. However, Arceus is usually better off just attacking instead of using Recover, especially compared to the usefulness of Taunt.

  • Earthquake is another niche option for Sticky Web teams over Double-Edge or Taunt, letting Arceus OHKO Zacian-C after a boost while hitting Garganacl. However, this is very specific because +2 Tera Normal Double-Edge has a roll to OHKO the former, even if Earthquake is better for Tera Ghost variants that do not use Double-Edge.

  • Silk Scarf gives Arceus a consistent damage output to Extreme Speed and Double-Edge that doesn't suffer from the recoil issues of Life Orb, giving Arceus improved longevity while still letting it OHKO offensive Primal Kyogre and Rayquaza with Extreme Speed after a boost.

  • Alternatively, Life Orb maximizes Arceus's offensive capabilities, allowing it to OHKO offensive Eternatus and offensive Ho-Oh after a boost. Unlike Silk Scarf, it improves the power of Shadow Claw as well, notably letting Arceus OHKO Giratina-O and Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM with +2 Tera Ghost Shadow Claw. However, the recoil hinders Arceus's longevity significantly, making it less capable of trading with other offensive threats, since it often faints itself from recoil.

  • Lum Berry can also be considered, since it enables easier setup against Ho-Oh, Alomomola, and Giratina-O. Unfortunately, it is too matchup-dependent, and the drop in power is very noticeable, making Arceus less threatening as a whole.

  • The first EV spread lets Arceus outspeed Adamant Kyurem-B as well as Marshadow and Zacian-C after Sticky Web. The rest is dumped into bulk, notably letting Arceus survive Mega Salamence's boosted Double-Edge from full HP. The second EV spread lets Arceus outspeed Chi-Yu while having enough bulk to survive Primal Kyogre's Origin Pulse and Life Orb Deoxys-A's Psycho Boost from full HP.

  • Tera Normal allows boosted Arceus to OHKO Double Dance Primal Groudon with Extreme Speed after Stealth Rock damage, as well as OHKOing defensive Yveltal and offensive Eternatus. It also empowers Double-Edge, letting it OHKO Zygarde and defensive Primal Groudon at +2 while even having a chance to 2HKO Dondozo. However, it lacks any defensive qualities unlike Tera Ghost and makes Giratina-O and Marshadow more difficult to handle, limiting its use to Sticky Web teams where Marshadow is no longer an issue.

  • Tera Ghost forces Marshadow to play a coinflip between its STAB moves, making Arceus more challenging to punish. It completely shuts down revenge killing attempts from Close Combat Zacian-C, Ditto, and Rayquaza. Offensively, it empowers Shadow Claw, notably letting boosted Arceus OHKO Choice Specs Lunala with Shadow Shield up as well as Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM with Life Orb.

  • Arceus lacks any notable defensive qualities outside of its raw bulk, limiting it just to hyper offense structures that want to capitalize on its fabulous wallbreaking and cleaning abilities. Depending on the moveset, Terastalization option, and opposing team structure, Arceus fluctuates between these two roles.

  • Double-Edge variants of Arceus are more suited to the early- or mid game where it can break through Pokemon such as defensive Ho-Oh and Coil Zygarde for teammates to profit from, especially since its poor longevity makes it difficult to trade with opposing offensive Pokemon or act as a sufficient sweeper.

  • Yveltal is a fantastic partner for Arceus, since it is able to threaten common checks to Arceus, such as Giratina-O, Zygarde, and Ferrothorn, while still being great at breaking past other physical walls such as defensive Primal Groudon and defensive Arceus-Dark. In return, Arceus helps break past specially defensive Pokemon such as Arceus-Fairy, Ho-Oh, and Fezandipiti. They are both capable of overwhelming a shared check in Zacian-C, with other offensive teammates such as Primal Groudon handling that further.

  • Zacian-C itself is a good partner, since it helps Arceus to overwhelm physical walls such as defensive Primal Groudon and Tera Water Zygarde. Zacian-C can help break through Giratina-O, similarly to Yveltal, as well as helping against opposing Arceus and Ditto attempting to revenge kill Arceus. They can both overwhelm a shared check in Necrozma-DM too.

  • Arceus fails to do anything meaningful against stall teams, since both Dondozo and Giratina shut it down with ease. On structures utilizing Sticky Web, Chi-Yu is a fantastic wallbreaker for Arceus, since it notably shreds through stall with its boosted attacks while still beating opposing Ghost-types such as Lunala and Giratina-O. It can even lure in and remove defensive Ho-Oh with +2 Black Hole Eclipse, letting Arceus clean through opposing teams more smoothly. Chi-Yu's fast Taunt helps maintain entry hazards for Arceus too, especially against Giratina-O.

  • Meteor Beam Lunala and Eternatus are very similar when it comes to wallbreaking, letting Arceus clean up better afterwards. Ultra Necrozma appreciates Arceus breaking past both Arceus-Dark and Yveltal, while it can blow through Necrozma-DM and Primal Groudon with Earthquake.

  • Suicide leads such as Deoxys-S and Glimmora provide entry hazards for Arceus to break through teams more easily, notably guaranteeing the OHKO on defensive Primal Groudon with +2 Tera Normal Double-Edge and letting Arceus more reliably OHKO Lunala with Shadow Claw once Shadow Shield is removed. Sticky Web support from Smeargle and Shuckle enables Arceus to outspeed foes such as Marshadow and Zacian-C, that would ordinarily revenge kill it.

  • These leads appreciate Arceus using Taunt to maintain their hazards. It should be noted that, barring Shuckle, they can prevent opposing hazards from going up, improving Arceus's longevity, which is especially important for Life Orb or Double-Edge variants.

Trick Room Setter.description:
• Due to its excellent bulk and Normal typing, Arceus is an excellent Trick Room setter. These qualities combined with a Mental Herb make it extremely difficult for threats such as Primal Kyogre, Zacian-C, and even Marshadow to stop Trick Room from being set up. Arceus also serves as a weak but useful revenge killler that can take out extremely chipped threats such as Primal Groudon and Yveltal with Extreme Speed.

  • Taunt prevents slow entry hazard setters such as Ferrothorn and Primal Groudon from setting hazards. It also prevents threats such as Necrozma-DM and, most importantly, Coil Zygarde from setting up or hindering it with Thunder Wave or Glare. In addition, Taunt prevents Ho-Oh from using Whirlwind to cancel Trick Room or from using Defog to remove entry hazards.

  • Extreme Speed allows Arceus to revenge kill any weakened targets that a teammate wasn’t able to finish off such as a defensive Primal Groudon; however, the lack of Attack investment makes Extreme Speed extremely weak, so the move should not be used often.

  • The given EV spread avoids an OHKO from Choice Band Marshadow’s Low Kick and a 2HKO from Life Orb Yveltal’s Dark Pulse.

  • Tera Steel prevents Glimmora and Smeargle from using Mortal Spin to clear entry hazards. Tera Ghost is more niche, allowing Arceus to set Trick Room against Extreme Speed Arceus in an emergency. However, Arceus is a poor user of Terastallization and it should be saved for teammates such as Calyrex-I or Melmetal.

  • Arceus is an excellent Trick Room setter throughout the game thanks to its giant bulk allowing it to set up Trick Room against nearly any unboosted threat. However, it is not to be used as the lead Trick Room setter due to its inability to deny entry hazards from opposing leads such as Deoxys-S, Mental Herb Shuckle, and Mega Diancie.

  • Pokemon that appreciate Trick Room support such as Calyrex-I and Melmetal make excellent teammates for Arceus. They also appreciate Arceus denying Necrozma-DM from using Morning Sun and Zygarde from using Coil and Rest, allowing them to wallbreak past these threats more efficiently.

  • Arceus appreciates additional Trick Room setters to support it in setting Trick Room and preventing entry hazards. Therefore, Hatterene and Cresselia make excellent teammates. Hatterene is able to deny entry hazards from most leads such as Shuckle, Deoxys-S, and Mega Diance, unlike Arceus. Cresselia is also able to restore the PP of teammates with low-PP STAB moves such as Melmetal and Calyrex-I.

Utility.description:
• With access to STAB Foul Play, high defensive stats, and its mono-Dark typing, Arceus-Dark effectively checks Pokemon such as Primal Groudon, Arceus, Necrozma-DM, Ultra Necrozma, and Mega Salamence, making it one of the most reliable defensive Arceus formes in NatDex Ubers.
  • Foul Play is absolutely essential for Arceus-Dark, as it serves two crucial roles: first, it allows Arceus-Dark to effectively revenge kill boosted threats such as Primal Groudon, Arceus, Ultra Necrozma, and Mega Salamence. Second, it acts as a deterrent, dissuading these threats from setting up until Arceus-Dark has been sufficiently weakened.
  • Toxic is the preferred status move for Arceus-Dark, primarily to cripple common switch-ins such as Ho-Oh, Yveltal, Primal Kyogre, and Arceus-Fairy. Will-O-Wisp presents a viable alternative for hitting Zacian-C and Marshadow, which is particularly relevant given Zacian-C's resistance to Foul Play.
  • Refresh is a solid choice when Arceus-Dark is utilized as a primary Knock Off and status absorber for the team, since it can reliably switch into Toxic Yveltal or Eternatus. However, in other scenarios, it's not recommended since it would render Arceus-Dark too passive against the aforementioned threats.
  • Taunt allows Arceus-Dark to greatly limit most of the entry hazard setters in the tier, namely Primal Groudon, Defensive Necrozma-DM, and Ferrothorn. Additionally, it can neutralize status spreaders like Toxic Yveltal, Ferrothorn, and Giratina-Origin, while also restricting the former's ability to use Defog. Taunt Arceus-Dark is also one of the best checks to Zygarde-C, as it can completely shut down its ability to spread paralysis and set up.
  • Defog serves as a good filler move when Arceus-Dark acts as hazard control over common Defoggers like Ho-Oh and Giratina-O. Stealth Rock can be a viable option to free up teammates to fulfill other roles; for example, it alows Primal Groudon to run more offensive sets such as Swords Dance, or fit Spikes on defensive set. In addition, Arceus-Dark's typing and movepool allow it to set up Stealth Rock on common Defoggers such as Ho-Oh, Giratina-O, and most opposing Arceus formes, all of which are threatened by Arceus-Dark's status moves.
  • Arceus-Dark's EV spread enables it to be faster than common base 90 Speed foes and also facilitates its role as a revenge killer against offensive Primal Groudon and Primal Kyogre. Alternatively, investing in Speed with EVs of 248 HP / 164 Def / 96 Spe and a Timid nature allows Arceus-Dark to outspeed Pokémon like Yveltal, Zekrom, and Rayquaza, and still survive a Life Orb Low Kick from Marshadow.
  • Tera Poison lets Arceus Dark acts as an emergency check to boosted Marshadow and Tera Fighting Zacian-C, making it possible to safely revenge kill them. Moreover, by becoming a Poison-type, Arceus-Dark becomes immune to Toxic, making it possible for non-Taunt versions to beat Toxic Yveltal one-on-one. However, Tera Poison makes Arceus-Dark extremely vulnerable to Photon Geyser Ultra Necrozma, Primal Groudon, Arceus-Ground, and Deoxys-A, thus trainers should think twice before Terastallizing Arceus-Dark.
  • Utility Arceus-Dark is an excellent fit for balance and defensive teams, offering a check to Zygarde-C and and other common physical sweepers such as Ultra Necrozma. Depending on the set used, some precautions should be taken with Arceus-Dark. Non-Refresh sets need to scout for Toxic before switching into Primal Groudon and Necrozma-DM. Similarly, it is important to scout for Glare Zygarde since Arceus-Dark doesn't enjoy being paralyzed.
  • Stealth Rock from Arceus-Dark itself or a teammate like Primal Groudon can wear down Fairy-types such as Arceus-Fairy that can switch into Arceus-Dark.
  • Since Necrozma-DM, the premier Toxic absorber of the tier, is heavily threatened by Foul Play, Arceus-Dark can often freely use Toxic on a predicted switch-in.
  • Primal Groudon and Swords Dance Arceus can overwhelm Arceus-Dark. To improve its matchup against these threats, teammates like Zygarde-C, Ferrothorn, and Ditto can provide valuable support.
  • Defensive Primal Groudon serves as a great partner for Arceus-Dark, threatening Eternatus, which walls Arceus-Dark. A similar role is accomplished by Ho-Oh, especially sets carrying Thunder Wave, which can make Arceus-Dark faster than it. Additionally, Ho-Oh appreciates Arceus-Dark's ability to deal with Knock Off Necrozma-DM and Ultra Necrozma.
  • Necrozma-DM is another partner that benefits from Arceus-Dark's ability to cripple Primal Groudon and Yveltal, and it provides a Fairy resistance and Toxic immunity in return.
  • Cleric support from Pokemon such as Magearna and Chansey can mitigate non-Refresh Arceus-Dark's weakness to status conditions.

Calm Mind.description:
• Calm Mind Arceus-Dark is an appealing option for balance and bulky offense teams that appreciate the role compression this set is able to provide. Arceus-Dark provides these teams with a sturdy win condition, a special wall, and a counter to Pokemon such as Ultra Necrozma and specially offensive Yveltal.
  • Arceus-Dark has some flexibility in its fourth moveslot. Refresh enables Arceus-Dark to shrug off status and enables a stronger mid-game presence, as it is able to switch into Pokemon such as Giratina-O and Ho-Oh with impunity. Refresh also enables Arceus-Dark to position itself for a sweep more easily, as it is not hampered by Toxic.
  • Taunt allows Arceus-Dark to easily shut down much of the defensive metagame and set up on Pokemon such as Ferrothorn and Zygarde, but it has to come in cautiously, as status conditions such as Toxic poison and paralysis from Ho-Oh, Giratina-O, and Zygarde heavily impede its ability to sweep prior to Terastallizing.
  • 4 Defense and 96 Speed EVs enable Arceus-Dark to survive Choice Band Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance and outspeed Chi-Yu. The remaining EVs are dumped into Special Defense, which enables Arceus-Dark to better function as a special wall. This is particularly important against specially offensive Yveltal, as Arceus-Dark is easily able to shrug off Oblivion Wing as opposed to being forced to use Recover. This investment also enables Arceus-Dark to use Meteor Beam Eternatus as setup fodder, as it can withstand the combination of Meteor Beam followed by +1 Dynamax Cannon.
  • Arceus-Dark's Tera type depends on whether it opts to run Refresh or Taunt. As Refresh Arceus-Dark does not have to worry about status, the defensive utility of Fairy is preferred. Tera Fairy enables Arceus-Dark to still check specially defensive Yveltal while also countering Palkia-O, as it is no longer concerned about Spacial Rend's critical hits; it also provides an immunity to attempts to phase it with Dragon Tail from Pokemon such as Giratina-O. Taunt Arceus-Dark opts for Tera Poison due to the poison immunity, as Toxic prevents it from sweeping; Tera Poison also provides additional utility by absorbing Eternatus's Toxic Spikes.
  • Against balance and bulky offense teams, Calm Mind Arceus-Dark is often used mid-game to defensively check Pokemon such as Giratina-O, Ho-Oh, Yveltal, and Zygarde. As the opposing team is worn down, Arceus-Dark often finds itself in a position late-game to start boosting and sweep.
  • As Arceus-Dark requires multiple boosts to become offensively threatening, it is often unable to sweep but plays an essential defensive role by checking Pokemon such as Ultra Necrozma and specially offensive Yveltal. Arceus-Dark's role against stall teams is heavily dependent on whether it opts to use Refresh or Taunt. If running Refresh, Arceus-Dark is an excellent pivot and status sponge that is capable of sweeping once Chansey is removed. Taunt Arceus-Dark has a more active role in stallbreaking, often utilizing Tera Poison and Taunt to preserve progress.
  • Zygarde is the best teammate for Arceus-Dark. As Arceus-Dark invests in Special Defense, it relies on Zygarde to check physically offensive threats that it itself is unable to such as Marshadow, Zacian-C, and Primal Groudon. In return, Arceus-Dark checks Pokemon that overwhelm Zygarde such as Eternatus and specially offensive Yveltal. Arceus-Dark also appreciates Defog and status support from Giratina-O and Ho-Oh in addition to their ability to check Primal Groudon and Zacian-C, respectively.
  • Arceus-Dark can struggle against other Calm Mind Arceus formes, especially Arceus-Fairy. Consequently, physical attackers such as Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM and Zacian-C are good teammates. Their ability to offensively check defensive Primal Kyogre is appreciated, as Arceus-Dark struggles to beat it without Taunt.

Defensive.description:
• Arceus-Fairy can perform a wide variety of defensive roles thanks to its Fairy typing, solid stats, wide movepool, and a nice Speed tier. It is able to switch into multiple top threats of the metagame such as Mega Salamence, Yveltal, Zygarde, Arceus-Dark, and Marshadow and cripple them with various options or set Stealth Rock as they're forced out, enabling it to fit in balance and defensive team structures.
  • Taunt allows Arceus-Fairy to prevent setup, recovery, entry hazards, hazard control via Defog, and crippling status moves such as Glare and Toxic from Pokemon such as Primal Groudon, Zygarde, Ho-Oh, and Giratina-O. This move isn't recommended on specially defensive variants, as it's relatively easy for foes, such as some variants of the Pokemon listed above, to outspeed Arceus-Fairy, thus rendering most of Taunt's purposes niche.
  • Toxic complements Judgment to cripple foes that can easily switch into it, including Ho-Oh, Arceus-Ground, and Primal Groudon, Will-O-Wisp alternatively allows Arceus-Fairy to cripple the Poison- and Steel-types it lures in, such as Zacian-C, Necrozma-DM, and Eternatus, while also creating an easier matchup against multiple physical attackers such as Terastallized Zygarde and Marshadow.
  • Stealth Rock forces progress for Arceus-Fairy's team, as it forces out relevant hazard removers such as Yveltal and Giratina-O. With Stealth Rock active, Arceus-Fairy has high odds to OHKO Ultra Necrozma and Palkia-O with Judgment.
  • Given Arceus-Fairy can often stay in on common hazard setters such as Primal Groudon, if Arceus-Fairy has Toxic, and opposing support Arceus formes, it can act as a viable Defogger.
  • Refresh increases Arceus-Fairy's longevity and consistency at checking foes, reducing the potential risk of switching into Glare from Zygarde and Toxic from Ho-Oh, Arceus-Dark, and Primal Groudon. It also renders special sets of Giratina-O unable to do much in return, as Hex does poor damage without a status condition.
  • The given EV spread with a Bold nature allows Arceus-Fairy to outspeed Primal Groudon to better facilitate using Taunt and Recover, with the rest of the EVs being placed in Defense to render it as physically bulky as possible, letting it avoid a 2HKO from Choice Band Marshadow's Poltergeist.
  • Alternatively, a specially defensive spread of 248 HP / 136 Def / 108 SpD / 16 Spe with a Calm nature lets Arceus-Fairy avoid a 2HKO from Palkia-O's Hydro Pump and Primal Groudon's Overheat and a 2HKO from Choice Band Marshadow's Spectral Thief after Stealth Rock, and it can outspeed uninvested Primal Groudon. Additionally it also allows Arceus-Fairy to check Mega Mewtwo Y, and after Terastallizing to the Poison-type, Eternatus. This spread, however, has the flaws of being easier to overwhelm by physical attackers and vulnerability to Taunt from Pokemon such as other defensive Arceus formes and Terastallized Yveltal.
  • Tera Water lets Arceus-Fairy more comfortably wall foes such as Primal Groudon, Zacian-C and Necrozma-DM, in turn allowing Arceus-Fairy to cripple them with a status condition. Arceus-Fairy also gains a resistance to Palkia-O's Hydro Pump, granting it the momentum to greatly damage it even if it uses its physically defensive spread.
  • Tera Poison increases Arceus-Fairy's longevity by giving it an immunity to Toxic and removing its weaknesses to Steel- and Poison-type moves, letting it switch into Zacian-C, Eternatus without Meteor Beam, Giratina-O, Arceus-Dark, and opposing Arceus-Fairy.
  • Arceus-Fairy is a Pokemon that does not Terastallize often, as its innate typing already provides the option to act as a wall for a good portion of the metagame, and its allies often make better use of it.
  • Arceus-Fairy's Judgment is often easy to switch into early- to mid-game, so most of the time utility moves are used instead for consistency and to continue making progress by crippling the other team.
  • Depending on the moveset, Arceus-Fairy can't respond to foes that resist Judgment such as Primal Groudon, Ho-Oh, and Necrozma-DM; therefore, it appreciates Pokemon that can answer them, which include Giratina-O, Primal Kyogre, and Marshadow.
  • Arceus-Fairy's bulk can be lacking on one side depending on its EV spread. Physically defensive variants can struggle against Palkia-O, Eternatus, and Arceus formes with Calm Mind, so it appreciates checks to them to complement its own defensive attributes like Ho-Oh, Necrozma-DM, and Primal Groudon. Meanwhile, specially defensive variants can have notable difficulties checking physical sweepers, which include Primal Groudon, Mega Salamence and Arceus, so Pokemon that can switch into them such as Giratina-O and Necrozma-DM are appreciated.

Calm Mind.description:
• Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy is an excellent bulky setup sweeper and wincon due to its excellent stats across the board, Fairy typing, and extensive coverage. Due to these qualities, it fits on a multitude of playstyles such as hyper offense, bulky offense, and balance.
  • Will-O-Wisp allows Arceus-Fairy to easily set up on Arceus, physical Arceus-Ground, and Mega Salamence lacking Facade. Power Gem is an option to hit Ho-Oh for meaningful damage. Taunt can be used to prevent Giratina-O, Primal Groudon, and Ho-Oh from crippling Arceus-Fairy with status such as Toxic or Thunder Wave and phazing it with Roar or Whirlwind. In addition, Taunt blocks Glare from Zygarde. Earth Power allows Arceus-Fairy to hit Primal Groudon, Eternatus, and Steel-types like Zacian-C and Necrozma-DM.
  • The given EV spread invests enough Speed for Arceus-Fairy to outspeed Primal Kyogre and Primal Groudon. The rest is invested into Defense and HP, giving Arceus-Fairy a high chance to survive a +2 Precipice Blades from Double Dance Primal Groudon while also avoiding an OHKO from Deoxys-A’s Psycho Boost after Stealth Rock and a 2HKO from Marshadow’s Poltergeist. The alternative EV spread with a Timid nature allows Arceus-Fairy to outspeed Modest Palkia-O and avoid a 2HKO from Choice Band Marshadow’s Spectral Thief after Stealth Rock.
  • Tera Dark provides Arceus-Fairy with a Psychic immunity, helping its team against powerful attacks such as Light That Burns the Sky from Ultra Necrozma, Psycho Boost from Deoxys-A, and Psystrike from Mega Mewtwo Y.
  • Tera Poison provides Arceus-Fairy a valuable immunity to Toxic and Toxic Spikes, allowing it to serve as the team’s Toxic Spikes absorber and check to opposing Arceus-Fairy and Eternatus.
  • Tera Ground ensures that Earth Power 2HKOes defensive Primal Groudon at +0 and gives it a chance to 2HKO defensive Necrozma-DM at +1.
  • On hyper offense, Arceus-Fairy is an excellent late-game wincon against a weakened team when checks such as Ho-Oh and Eternatus have been removed. On bulky offense and balance, Arceus-Fairy serves as an excellent check to Marshadow, Yveltal, and unboosted Mega Salamence throughout the game. It should not be afraid to switch into attacks from the aforementioned Pokemon, as any damage can be healed off with Recover. Arceus-Fairy must be wary of Toxic from Yveltal, Ho-Oh, and Giratina-O, which can heavily undermine its ability to sweep.
  • Arceus-Fairy’s sweeping ability is often hampered due to it being outsped by common threats such as Eternatus, Zacian-C, and Deoxys-A. For hyper offense, Sticky Web support from Shuckle flips these matchups and allows Arceus-Fairy to beat these checks. For bulky offense and balance, Thunder Wave support from Necrozma-DM eliminates this problem. Arceus-Fairy also appreciates duel screens support from Deoxys-S or Grimmsnarl, as this eases setup.
  • Regardless of what is chosen in the fourth moveslot, Arceus-Fairy will always suffer from a lack of coverage, as having Power Gem means it struggles against Primal Groudon, and having Earth Power means it cannot break past Ho-Oh. Teammates that can cover these vulnerabilities such as Primal Kyogre and Ultra Necrozma are helpful. Gothitelle is also a good teammate, as it effectively traps and removes walls such as Tera Steel Giratina-O, Ferrothorn, and Ho-Oh.

Calm Mind + Refresh.description:
• Compressing the roles of a stallbreaker, wall, and sweeper, Arceus-Fairy uses its lack of common weaknesses, well-rounded stats, and high longevity to act as a usable win condition against bulky team structures for balance teams.
  • Refresh ensures that Arceus-Fairy can't be hindered long-term by moves such as Toxic from Ho-Oh and Primal Groudon, easing the act of applying pressure on the opposing team and allowing more aggressive play compared to Taunt by not requiring it to safely switch into and outspeed a foe to avoid being inflicted with a status condition.
  • The first EV spread with a Bold nature outspeeds base 90 Speed foes such as Primal Groudon and Primal Kyogre, with the rest invested into physical bulk to have high odds at avoiding a 2HKO from Double Dance Primal Groudon's Precipice Blades; it additionally avoids a 2HKO from Choice Band Marshadow's Poltergeist as well as an OHKO from Life Orb Deoxys-A's Psycho Boost after Stealth Rock. The second EV spread with a Timid nature outspeeds neutral-natured base 120 Speed foes including Palkia-O and Mega Salamence and avoids a 2HKO from Choice Band Marshadow's Spectral Thief after Stealth Rock.
  • Tera Dark allows Arceus-Fairy to beat Psychic-types such as Ultra Necrozma and Mega Mewtwo Y one-on-one and become immune to status moves from the niche Grimmsnarl, all while retaining a Dark resistance to still handle foes such as Yveltal and Chien-Pao.
  • Arceus-Fairy should be used primarily as a wall early- to mid-game, as the need to use Calm Mind several times to break past Fairy-resistant foes makes it setup fodder for foes such as Double Dance Primal Groudon, Ho-Oh, and Zacian-C.
  • Arceus-Fairy can often brute force past bulky foes such as Terastallized Coil Zygarde, Primal Kyogre, and defensive Primal Groudon thanks to its high longevity, but it should be careful to preserve its Judgment and Recover PP.
  • While Arceus-Fairy acts as a good status absorber for its team thanks to Refresh, a turn is required to use it, which can often lead to scenarios where the opponent exploits this detail to safely bring in an offensive check against Arceus-Fairy. Therefore, it sometimes may be desirable to not immediately use Refresh after being subject to a status condition.
  • As Arceus-Fairy can struggle with Fairy-resistant foes such as opposing Primal Groudon, Ho-Oh, and Necrozma-DM, often limiting its potential against bulky team structures. Partners such as Zygarde and Primal Groudon can apply offensive pressure against these foes, and Gothitelle can trap and remove Ho-Oh and Necrozma-DM.
  • Pokemon such as Ferrothorn, Giratina-O, and Primal Kyogre handle Taunt users that can heavily limit Arceus-Fairy such as opposing Arceus-Water and Arceus-Ground. Ferrothorn, in particular,also supports Arceus-Fairy by discouraging switches with the entry hazards it sets, easing Arceus-Fairy's wallbreaking.

Calm Mind.description:
• Flying-type Judgment is what differentiates Arceus-Flying from other Arceus formes like Arceus-Dark and Arceus-Fairy at its bulky sweeper role, since Flying-resistant Pokemon are much less common in the tier. Its immunity to Sticky Web and Toxic Spikes is also a distinct advantage, with the former immunity being especially useful against hyper offense structures. However, the lack of notable resistances makes it somewhat difficult for Arceus-Flying to reliably set up against strong attackers, especially since many outspeed Arceus-Flying such as Marshadow and Zacian-C, and a weakness to Stealth Rock means that it lacks defensive utility for the hyper offense teams it fits best on, meaning it suffers heavy competition from other Flying-types like Mega Salamence and Yveltal.
  • Taunt stops Arceus-Flying from being passive as it sets up against Pokemon like Necrozma-DM, prevents Ho-Oh from using Whirlwind against it, and limits the progress made by Pokemon such as Ferrothorn and support Arceus formes by restricting their entry hazard and status-spreading abilities. Alternatively, Refresh allows Arceus-Flying to play more aggressively, ignoring the risk of coming into status moves from Alomomola, Zygarde and Giratina-O.
  • The given EV spread allows Arceus-Flying to avoid the 2HKO from physical utility Giratina-O's Poltergeist and the OHKO from offensive support Primal Groudon's Overheat, all while 2HKOing Tera Grass Ho-Oh. The alternative EV spread maximises Arceus-Flying's offensive capabilities, notably letting it 2HKO Giratina-O with Judgment after a boost.
  • Tera Steel allows Arceus-Flying to remove its Ice and Rock weaknesses, potentially letting it set up on Pokemon like Chien-Pao, changes its Stealth Rock weakness into a resistance, and grants it a Toxic immunity, which is very useful for the less aggressive Taunt variants. Tera Fairy removes these weaknesses too alongside granting a Dark resistance, letting Arceus-Flying handle Yveltal and Arceus-Dark better and using Taunt to stop the latter from using recovery options, while keeping its Fighting resistance against Marshadow.
  • Arceus-Flying is best used mid- or late-game when the opposing team has been broken down enough so that it can clean up after one or two boosts. It should be careful about being statused though, since Taunt variants have no way to remove status, and Refresh variants have to take a turn to remove them, which could lead to the opponent getting a free opportunity to bring in a Pokemon that checks Arceus-Flying such as Zacian-C.
  • Arceus-Flying struggles greatly against Flying-resistant foes, and, although there are few in number, Necrozma-DM, Zacian-C, and the more niche Zekrom and Garganacl can all be problems for Arceus-Flying. Double Dance Primal Groudon and Tera Blast Ground Zacian-C are potent teammates, being able to break through the aforementioned foes, while Arceus-Flying is able to break through opposing Primal Groudon and Zygarde for them in return. Marshadow is also able to break through both Necrozma-DM and Garganacl for Arceus-Flying, as well as breaking through specially defensive walls such as Chansey for it, while Arceus-Flying can soft-check Yveltal for it in return.
  • Suicide leads such as Deoxys-S, Glimmora and Mega Diancie, that can not only provide hazard support, letting Arceus-Flying 2HKO Primal Kyogre with boosted Judgment after Stealth Rock, but deny entry hazards from opposing Pokemon such as Ferrothorn or Primal Groudon, are fantastic teammates, helping in Arceus-Flying's wallbreaking capabilities and longevity. Smeargle and Shuckle providing Sticky Web support lets Arceus-Flying outspeed opposing Calm Mind Arceus formes more consistently, letting it beat them one-on-one.

Setup Sweeper.description:
• Arceus-Ghost's singular Ghost typing gives it a unique presence both offensively and defensively. For the hyper offense structures it fits on, it serves as a check to Extreme Killer Arceus, as well as a spinblocker against Rapid Spin Smeargle. With Ghostium Z, Arceus-Ghost makes for a strong wallbreaker that is able to push past would-be checks such as Zygarde and defensive Ho-Oh.

  • However, Dark-types such as Yveltal and Arceus-Dark are a major nuisance for Arceus-Ghost, especially their defensive variants that can take hits with ease. Meanwhile, other Ghost-types, such as Marshadow and Lunala, don't have to worry about them as much due to their superior coverage combined with access to Terastalization.

  • Additionally, taking up a Z-Move slot on the hyper offense teams it is mandatory on makes it hard to justify over Ultra Necrozma and Chi-Yu, both of which perform similar roles to it. There's also the issue of it taking up the Arceus slot compared to using Extreme Killer Arceus or Arceus-Ground, both of which are more consistent. Regardless, Arceus-Ghost's combination of offensive and defensive traits, as well as it being naturally Imposter-proof against Ditto, carves it a small niche.

  • Swords Dance allows Arceus-Ghost to OHKO Zygarde and defensive Primal Groudon with +2 Never-Ending Nightmare as well as offensive Eternatus with +2 Shadow Force. Alternatively, Dragon Dance allows it to outspeed Chien-Pao, Zacian-C, and Deoxys-A, preventing the former from revenge killing it as easily. Arceus-Ghost can still OHKO defensive Ho-Oh and defensive Primal Kyogre with +1 Never-Ending Nightmare, as well as Necrozma-DM and Giratina-O with +1 Shadow Force, even if its wallbreaking capabilities are limited.

  • Shadow Force is mostly used to provide the strongest possible Never-Ending Nightmare for Arceus-Ghost. Its two-turn nature can be awkward, which is why Ghostium Z is needed for circumvent this issue . More notably though, this makes Arceus-Ghost Imposter-proofed against Ditto, since the latter will always outspeed it, thus never hitting it if they both use Shadow Force at the same time.

  • Stone Edge allows Arceus-Ghost to snipe Ho-Oh and Yveltal, removing Arceus-Ghost's need to use its Z-Move to OHKO the former to prevent it from phazing. Unboosted Stone Edge OHKOes offensive Ho-Oh and can more reliably OHKO defensive Ho-Oh and specially offensive Yveltal after a boost.

  • Alternatively, Brick Break enables Arceus-Ghost to 2HKO Arceus-Dark and Arceus at +1. It also hits more niche targets, such as Chien-Pao, Garganacl, and Kingambit, that may be annoying for Arceus-Ghost to deal with. It should be noted that both coverage options hit Chi-Yu super effectively, although +2 Shadow Force OHKOes it regardless.

  • Extreme Speed is a niche option that can snipe Deoxys-A for Swords Dance variants while limiting Yveltal and Chien-Pao's ability to revenge kill it with Sucker Punch, but it is quite weak and only works well against opposing offense teams, not bulkier ones.

  • Substitute protects Arceus-Ghost from harmful status conditions, such as burn from Ho-Oh's Sacred Fire and poison from Alomomola's Toxic, and limits Yveltal's and Chien-Pao's ability to revenge kill it with priority moves. Dragon Dance variants also benefit from Substitute limiting Marshadow's ability to pick it off with Shadow Sneak too; however, it can simply outspeed and bypass Substitute with Spectral Thief against Swords Dance variants.

  • Alternatively, Taunt denies status moves, whether it be entry hazards from Ferrothorn or opposing setup such as Coil Zygarde and Curse Dondozo, preventing the former from reliably checking it. It also maintains hazards against Ho-Oh and Giratina-O. Recover is a niche option that provides Arceus-Ghost more longevity, but it is much less useful than the other two options.

  • The first given EV spread is ideal for Swords Dance variants, allowing Arceus-Ghost to survive Choice Band Marshadow's Tera Ghost Shadow Sneak, and maximum Speed investment lets it Speed tie with Modest Palkia-O and Adamant Mega Salamence, although this may be problematic against Substitute variants of the former.

  • Alternatively, the second EV spread is used for Dragon Dance variants. It still avoids the OHKO from Choice Band Marshadow's Tera Ghost Shadow Sneak—now after Stealth Rock—as well as Choice Band Tera Flying Rayquaza's Dragon Ascent and wallbreaker Primal Kyogre's Origin Pulse. However, it also makes Arceus-Ghost significantly slower; it is unable to outspeed fully invested Primal Groudon and Primal Kyogre, but it does still outspeed Deoxys-A after a boost.

  • Arceus-Ghost relies heavily on Ghostium Z to maximize its wallbreaking capabilities against Coil Zygarde, defensive Primal Groudon, and support Arceus formes. It should only be used against these bulkier foes and not frailer targets such as Deoxys-A and Mega Mewtwo Y. This is especially true for Swords Dance variants that focus more on wallbreaking early- or mid game than sweeping.

  • Dragon Dance variants of Arceus-Ghost should be preserved until late-game where Dark-types such as Arceus-Dark and Yveltal have been worn down significantly either by hazards or by teammates such as Meteor Beam Eternatus and Mega Salamence. Waiting until late-game also minimizes the risk of a sudden Terastalization, such as Tera Dark Ho-Oh and Arceus-Fairy, even if these are niche situations. Arceus-Ghost does not need significant boosts to clean up weakened teams.

  • Pokemon that are able to break through Dark-types are greatly appreciated. Zacian-C can use offensive variants of Yveltal and Arceus-Dark as setup fodder due to resisting all their STAB options barring the niche Heat Wave from Yveltal. Meteor Beam Eternatus does well against defensive Yveltal and defensive Arceus-Dark while also sniping Ho-Oh. Both of these partners appreciate Arceus-Ghost's ability to break past common defensive Pokemon, such as Primal Groudon, Zygarde, and Ho-Oh.

  • Suicide leads are essential for supporting Arceus-Ghost. Smeargle and Shuckle are great for Swords Dance variants, making up for its low Speed and preventing Chien-Pao and Marshadow from easily revenge killing it. Deoxys-S and Glimmora work well with Dragon Dance variants, making up for its lesser power with hazard support; this also limits Choice Scarf Yveltal's ability to switch into Arceus-Ghost, since it can be OHKOed by +1 Stone Edge after Stealth Rock. They all appreciate Arceus-Ghost discouraging Giratina-O and Ho-Oh from removing their hazards via Defog, if not denying removal entirely with Taunt.

Calm Mind.description:
• Arceus-Ground serves as one of the tier's best special attackers, working as a strong wallbreaker and setup sweeper with Judgment and a coverage move of choice thanks to its strong matchups into top Pokemon, such as Primal Groudon and Eternatus. Arceus-Ground also works as a sweeper by saving its HP for late-game after its checks have been worn down. It typically fits best on bulky offense and balance teams.
  • Calm Mind boosts Arceus's already-strong Special Attack and Special Defense. While the offensive upside is obvious, it is also valuable defensively. At +1, Arceus-Ground survives attacks such as defensive Primal Kyogre's Scald and Life Orb Deoxys-A's Ice Beam. Arceus-Ground can set up on Pokémon that it forces out such as Meteor Beam Eternatus and offensive utility Primal Groudon.
  • Judgment hits key targets for super effective damage, such as OHKOing offensive Zacian-C, offensive Primal Groudon, and Meteor Beam Eternatus. Defensive Primal Groudon is OHKOed after Stealth Rock and a layer of Spikes. At +1, Judgment threatens to 2HKO defensive Arceus sets, such as Arceus-Dark and Arceus-Water, along with securing the 2HKO on defensive Necrozma-DM. Also at +1, Judgment OHKOs defensive Primal Groudon and Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM while 2HKOing offensive Primal Kyogre and Calyrex-I.
  • Ice Beam provides coverage for Flying-type Pokemon, OHKOing offensive Mega Salamence, Zygarde, and Rayquaza. It also 2HKOes offensive Yveltal sets and does good chip damage to Giratina-O.
  • Power Gem also hits Flying-types for super effective damage, even if it misses out on hitting Dragon-types such as Giratina-O and Zygarde. One major benefit to running Power Gem, however, is hitting Ho-Oh. Defensive Ho-Oh walls Ice Beam variants but gets 2HKOed by Power Gem, forcing it to Terastallize if it wants to continue to wall Arceus-Ground.
  • Recover is used to prevent Arceus-Ground from getting worn down over the course of a game by healing off damage from entry hazards or weak moves such as Alomomola's Flip Turn. It can also be used to soft check certain attackers in a pinch, such letting Life Orb Marshadow chip itself down into range of Judgment, or helping Arceus-Ground beat defensive Primal Groudon and Eternatus more reliably.
  • An alternative EV spread of 72 HP / 60 Def / 252 SpA / 124 Spe with a Modest nature can be used. This spread gives it an excellent matchup against Trick Room teams, as after Tera Water, it is 3HKOed by Choice Band Melmetal's Double Iron Bash and Choice Band Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance, and it has enough offensive EVs to OHKO uninvested Eternatus with Judgment and OHKO uninvested Zygarde with Ice Beam. Without Tera, Arceus-Ground also survives two offensive Necrozma-DM's Sunsteel Strikes, and it can survive Draco Meteor from Choice Specs Eternatus after a layer of Spikes. The downside of using this spread comes primarily at the cost of lowering its Speed, letting it get outsped by maximum speed Arceus formes and Palkia-O.
  • Tera Ground is used to bolster the offensive power of Judgment, turning defensive Necrozma-DM from a likely 2HKO after Leftovers to a guaranteed 2HKO. It also secures the OHKO against defensive Primal Groudon and turns specially defensive Eternatus from a 2HKO into a likely OHKO after hazard damage. It also allows Arceus-Ground to brute force past potential checks such as defensive Primal Kyogre and Arceus-Water.
  • Tera Water turns Arceus-Ground's weaknesses to Ice-type and Water-type moves into resistances, which allows it to beat defensive Primal Kyogre easily while also handling offensive variants, albeit less comfortably. Tera Water also flips the matchup against Calyrex-I, allowing Arceus-Ground to tank Glacial Lance.
  • This Arceus-Ground set is best applicable to bulky offensive and balance teams. Its raw strength and good bulk allow it to come into the game multiple times to get setup opportunities. It enjoys hazard support from teammates such as Primal Groudon. Another option is Wish support, such as Alomomola, whose Wish and Flip Turn combination allows Arceus-Ground to be brought in against many of the tier's threats. Alomomola also serves as a status absorber for Arceus-Ground. Choice Band Rayquaza is another great partner to pivot Arceus-Ground into the game while also OHKOing wallbreaker Primal Kyogre. It also serves as a stallbreaker, a needed role on Arceus-Ground teams, as it struggles to break stall teams long-term.
  • Other good partners for Arceus-Ground include strong physical attackers such as Choice Band Marshadow, whose strength allows it to break through special walls that Arceus-Ground may struggle to break through, such as Ho-Oh and support Arceus formes, and other special setup Pokemon such as Calm Mind Primal Kyogre.

Physical Setup Sweeper.description:
• Physical Arceus-Ground is an excellent wallbreaker and sweeper on hyper and bulky offense teams. It easily finds turns to boost due to scaring out common Pokemon such as Primal Groudon and Necrozma-DM.
